title: Art Feedback Mega Thread
body:
Hey everyone!

I wanted to create a space for everyone to give feedback about Art in the game, as Iron Stylus mentioned there's a broad range of artists at the company:

* Concept 
* 3D Character
* 3D Environment 
* Animation
* VFX 
* Motion Graphics
* UI Artists

I want this to be a place all the artists can visit to see your most requested changes\fixes to the art and just to get some general feedback about how everyone feels about what's going on. While I won't be able to respond to everyone, I'm going to be keeping an eye on this and hopefully get information to the right people.

What this is for:

* Feedback about our art decisions
* Feedback on new art
* Feedback about how art is affecting gameplay
* Constructive Criticism 
* Letting us know what you think

What this is not for:

* Champ/skin concepts: go here for that: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts
* Non-constructive criticism, e.g. This new art sucks I hate it (explain why you don't like it, offer up some solutions if you have any)
* Trolling {{champion:48}} 

I'm excited to hear from everyone :)

In regards to Syndra's {{champion:134}} base skin, as a whole:

Over all, I don't understand the inconsistent design behind her original look. From her title, backstory, and theme, you expect a dark regal/noble being commanding tremendous power with skill/fluency not seen elsewhere. Her abilities animate and show well, her voice work is great, but then you get to her person/body and it suddenly goes sideways.

The helm is a magnificent piece (both in design and meaning) and works well with her head, but then her shoulders and torso fumble the look. Her shoulders have the beginning of swept upward spikes, a good compliment to the helm, but then she's left with nothing to follow up with. Her shoulder pieces are somehow connected to her body, while the rest of her torso is a flimsy 9.99$ set of bondage gear. 

I mean, what? Why does an all powerful Sovereign share what Evelynn wears? Should I have the evocation of a floating stripper? Why does she have all this tacked on armor then? The sash is neat, I guess? It looks like it was added on to cover up the crotch shot she'd have from the extreme strap work going on.

Her arm guards/finger jewelry looks like it belonged to a different design - they work, but don't sync up with her torso. The same can essentially be said of the leggings as well. I've always been bothered by how unnecessarily sexualized her design is, even 500? something games and counting. She has great potential to show off royal(?) Ionian dressings/regalia, but that's just thrown out the window for no apparent reason. She doesn't gain anything but virtually having no torso clothes, nor does it really show much of Ionia itself.

It's just there for T & A, and I don't understand why.

You forget that she is an egotistical power hungry narcissist that thinks she is the absolute perfect being. She probably thinks she is at the same level of Xerath.

This likely extends beyond just her abilty to throw tiny black balls(speaking of which...that's the best you can come up with Riot?) around, but she sees herself as perfect in regards to mind and body as well. She considers herself deserving of freedom and liberation as she holds so much more power than others in Ionia, hence why she is okay with killing her master and practice her art without restraint. She has no problem showing off just how awesome she is as shown by the fact that she constantly quotes about how amazing her power is when unleashed, and how she floats around with her tiny black balls(you can do better Riot...).

A person with her ego would also view her perfect body(and let's face it, her body IS perfect) as something to behold as well. If you have something magnificent, and you also have the same ego as Syndra, would you dress like a monk and hide your body from other's sight? Or would you let others behold the magnificence of your perfect form?



As for why she isn't buck naked then, well...this isn't an AO game.
---------------
PS - as for your idea of what Syndra should be wearing rather than her current attire. It'd be more fitting of a monk, a politician, a utilitarian mage in the military, etc.

Syndra is none of that. She is a teenager gifted with untold amounts of power left to her own devices.

Oh, I'm well aware of Syndra's personality type and motivations - I simply do not subscribe to the idea she is of unsound mind, a 'teenager', 'angsting', or any other qualifiers of immaturity or insanity. That discredits the complexity of her motivations and character.

If I was something magnificent like Syndra, as you suppose, I would concern myself with finery and jewels unlike anyone else. Flaunting the body is a pointless affair when everyone has one - especially in a society that emphasizes training or exercise. Jewels and luxuries is something not everyone has, and that would showcase excellence more than anything else. This is generally in line with our own societies as well - high ruler culture emphasized the grandeur of wealth and scantly bothered with exposure of the flesh, generally speaking. Again, Syndra's design is almost in line with this, but drops the ball with her torso garments.

As to my suggestions, well, this is our fundamental divide. You see her as a child with insane power. I see a ruler of her own fate and power. Yet, mysteriously, the Dark Sovereign's aesthetic is closer to a stripper than the nobility the Emperor of the Sands possesses.

Hi there!

I wanted to tell you guys that I absolutely love the new Summoners Rift art and I 'm super exited for what's still to come and all the talk about the updated map and it's story. So this could be the right board to post some of my thoughts on it!

I got to test the updated map myself on the PBE, it is amazing how beautiful it is and the unique atmosphere it brings. Way to go!

However, there is one thing that I don't like about the current map on the PBE and it may sound weird, but it is the flowers in the lanes.
There are some oddly shaped blue flowers everywhere on the three lanes and I personally think these flowers could be done better. I think they look weird because of the flower art, textures and the long peduncles. I just feel they don't compete with the other very nice textures of the map an that makes me sad, I know you can deliver better quality

On the contrary, I think that the flowers in the jungles are a very good example of how good looking flowers should be like, take a look for yourself!

I've added an example of the flowers i'm criticizing down below. Thanks for the hard work and for hearing the community like you do Riot.

Cheers.

I play the game on max graphics settings and you can clearly see the difference of quality between the flowers and the rest of the textures in my screenshot.

You can find a good example for a comparison in the top left corner of my screenshot. 
Near the turret there is a part of the wall that is broken, revealing the trunk of the tree behind it, next to the trunk there is a bunch of flowers for you to compare the quality between these two. You can clearly see that the texture art on the trunk and wall exceeds by many times the quality of the flower textures. Even the moss and ivy on the walls are more defined than the flowers.

I might seem to be criticizing an extremely small issue here but the reason why I'm making such a point about this is that the flowers are a big part of the SR environment and they add greatly to the vibe and  ambient feel of the map. it's a shame that even the ivy on the broken walls have more detail than these flowers. 

I pay a lot of attention to artistic details and so they are important to me and probably a bunch of other people who care about visual details, the flowers on SR are eye catching and thematically important so they deserve a little more love than this!

Well, where shall I start...

I am really not a fan of {{champion:7}}'s texture rebalancing.  Specifically, her skin tone looks... wrong.  Just very very wrong.  Her new skin up on the PBE has a skin tone that looks pretty much perfect, could you just apply that colour to her base and the rest of her skins? Also, could you just take another pass at Prestigious skin specifically?  For a skin based on a flamboyant, colourful profession like stage magician, it now looks really, really drab and dull.

Second, I JUST posted a [thread](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/HWheZi1r-ironstylus-concerning-evelynns-tuvu) about {{champion:28}}'s TU, literally like a minute ago. Evelynn's update clearly goes beyond the realm of texture rebalancing into straight up texture update. My understanding though is that TUs are reserved for champs that already have solid rigs that hold up well, while Evelynn's rig is so bad that it's been stated she will never get a new skin until she gets a full on VU. Isn't all the work on the TU going to go to waste?  Or is her VU just THAT far away?
**EDIT:** In hindsight, the bit about Evelynn might actually be more appropriate in it's own thread rather than this one, but I'm not certain so I left it in anyways.

Third, Championship {{champion:102}}.  Once again, just made [a thread](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/VEkdmhsU-championship-shyvana) about this yesterday. Short version: really excited she's getting the championship skin, but her dragon form seems a bit too heavy on the blue and feels like it needs a bit more of another colour for contrast, while her human form's face is kinda wonky looking.  In the thread I made, [SirSkillshotz](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/player/NA/SirSkillshotz) made some VERY in-depth posts detailing just what feels wrong about her face.

For the Shyvana{{champion:102}} one, I must add that the head of the dragon form seems abit much. Looks great as gauntlets, but seems overcrowded while a dragon. As well as her joke/taunt animations with the gauntlets seem off as I'm sure those were animated with thoughts of her hands not getting so big with visual clutter. Human form's colour palette is already, but I must agree with the poster above me for dragon form's.

So In short, here's my problems: 
**1. Dragon Form-** Axes on head don't seem right
**2. Dragon Form-** Colour palette needs some re-thinking abit
**3. Human Form-** Gauntlets don't look right with joke and taunt animations

Those are just the problems I'm having with the skin

Well i'l be making a lot of request/feedback


MAP related ( SR update )


#1 : Add a visual animation for the tower hits just like how the champions have hit animations

The tower needs an attack animation like champions since it already has a break between each of its attack making it possible for utilizing its down time to harass the enemy under the tower while the player is also within the towers attack range. Its kind of pointless for experienced players as they know the timing but for newcomers it'l make sense as they would be wondering as to why the tower didn't attack the enemy champion while the player was being damaged by the enemy under the his own tower. The particle effects and the sound indicator you guys added in 2013 was a nice addition but now adding this extra tower hit animation will make it even more clearer. Just like how champions move their arms to indicate an incoming attack,the  towers also needs them too since they deal a lot of damage. 


#2 : clouds/fog/mist/flying creatures as fog of war

i would love to see a different approach towards showing fog of war than just with shadows that's being used currently. Can u guys use some smoke/fog effects in certain areas since already there r regions where it rains. So instead of using the same shadow everywhere u can use different effects based on different parts of the map, like how you guys did with the rain effects on the new SR map. 
How about some clouds too to go along with this. I've always liked how in the old/current SR map and in the SR update we can see the shadows of moving clouds on the ground. So i thought since we players view the map from top it would be better to have some clouds to go along with it too. Just make them transparent but still visible. But alas this has a problem of disturbing the players vision :(


#3: Add more details to make the sky come alive along with the cloud I mentioned in the 2nd point.

I love how the map is more alive than before with non interactive creatures (clearer and better than those flies,ants of the current SR map). The rain makes it more organic and alive than pure virtual look, but why its always raining only in that same red side blue buff spot ??? :(
How about adding some shadow of flying birds/dragons etc just like how its done with the clouds that's there on current and updated SR. Also make some of unique animations or things pop up once a while when the player plays the game, these objects should occur rarely/randomly but never for all the matches.
This kinda makes the map last more fresh as the player keeps finding new stuff. Just yesterday when i was playing the SR update on custom i noticed the creature standing next to the middle tier 3 tower's stairs, and as i walked towards it with my champion trying to see it more clearly zoomed in it ran off :(. Would love to interact with those creatures like how we can do with the
poros on Howling Abyss. 


#4 : requesting to hide the fog of war areas completely by using clouds {This is not a repetition of my 2nd point} 

The problem of playing games with this view is that we loose the sense of exploration and remembering areas that we can't see. 3rd person games and 1st person games all have that unique feel making it really fun to explore the hidden areas of the map and remember the terrain structures. 
Hiding the terrain and the rest of the map that's in fog of war is possible by using the clouds like i mentioned earlier. This also increases the skill cap of the players as they r now required to remember the terrain of a distant location from his champions/visible area's current location. 
Its not necessary to completely hide the areas hidden by the fog of war but its good to have certain parts being blocked by some obstruction like clouds if its in fog of war.
Well, the name Summoner's RIFT never made mouch sense it being in a forest, but why did you decide to now make it into a mountain peak of all things?

It may still be early in the game to say, but I was playing on Howling Abyss the other day and I noticed as I was using Iron Solari Leona, her model appeared very dark. There were heavy shadows over large parts of her body, making her color scheme feel very different.

I wasn't sure if this was part of a new dynamic lighting algorithm for champs so I'm not calling it a bug. I just felt that the lighting I experienced on Howling Abyss reduced some of the clarity about Leona. It was harder to pick up on her exact location as the shadowy lighting made her blend a bit with the darker portions of the bridge.

I also bring it up because it seemed a significant change in feel from when there was no dynamic lighting and from any angle her armor gleamed brilliantly, like a champion of the sun. The new texture feels very soft, and pastelle like the new SR, but it seems to have come at the cost of her radiant color scheme to some degree.

Anyway, not a complaint, just an observation and a general feeling from someone who loves Iron Solari Leona. Thanks!

This really isn't the place for us to be having this argument,

**Feedback**
I think the HP value you've added for Sion's shield buff icon is a very nice touch. Definitely should be used more.

**Suggestions**
Updated **ability icons** are a relatively low cost improvement that we don't see enough of. Some champions like Ashe and Tryndamere never really had any big changes, but you guys gave them spruced up icons, which was a nice little touch. While you're doing all these texture rebalancing, why not do a mass icon rebalance for champions like Rammus and Mundo too?

However, it's totally understandable to not update the icons of someone who is bound to get a more comprehensive rework like Poppy.

I'd also categorize **item icons** as a similar low cost improvement. I doubt these two take too many resources to do for the amount of visual improvement and cohesiveness they would provide.

Animations:
